data.title: San Marino, CA
data.text:
Elections

General Municipal Election, November 5, 2024

Elections are consolidated with the County and are held in November on the first Tuesday after the first Monday of even-numbered years. San Marino City Council Terms are staggered so that three seats are available during one election cycle and two seats are available during the next cycle.

There are two seats up for election in the 2024 General Municipal Election. In addition to the candidate election, the following measure is to be voted on: Shall an ordinance be adopted to continue the Special Public Safety Tax for Paramedic Services, Fire Protection and Prevention, and Police Protection in the City of San Marino, estimated to generate $3,700,000 annually, subject to an annual cost of living increase, until 2029?

Notice of Election

Notice of Last Day to Submit Arguments for Public Safety Parcel Tax Measure

Arguments and Rebuttal Form

Authorization Form for Another Person to Sign Rebuttal Argument

Draft Ordinance: Public Safety Parcel Tax

The LA County Registrar-Recorder/County Clerk provides online information regarding the election, registering to vote, vote by mail, and more.

Voter Registration

Register to vote or update your registration at www.registertovote.ca.gov

Already registered? Check to be sure your registration is current at www.voterstatus.sos.ca.gov

City Council

The candidate nomination period for the November 2024 election began on July 15, 2024.

Candidate Information: Frequently Asked Questions

There are two seats up for election in the 2024 General Municipal Election.

The requirements for candidates for elective offices of the City are as follows: a United States citizen; at least 18 years of age; a resident of the City of San Marino for at least 30 days prior to filing nomination papers; and, a registered voter in the City of San Marino at the time of nomination. Qualifying individuals may contact the City Clerk's Office at (626) 300-0705, during normal office hours Monday through Thursday between the hours of 7 AM and 5 PM and Friday between the hours of 7 AM. and 11 AM.

The Nomination Period opened on Monday, July 15, 2024, and closes on Friday, August 9, 2024, at 5:00 PM. For more information, please contact the City Clerk’s Office: (626) 300-0705 or CityClerk@SanMarinoCA.gov

Below are important to dates to remember if you are interested in running for election. The LA County Registrar/Recorder/County Clerk has a Municipal Information Booklet that is available online for reference. Additionally, the City provides a handbook to candidates when Nomination Papers are pulled.

Important Dates:

July 15 First Day that Declaration of Candidacy / Nomination Papers are Available for Candidates August 9 Deadline to Submit Declaration of Candidacy / Nomination Papers August 15 Secretary of State to Determine Order of Names on Ballot August 10*-19 Public Review Period for Candidates Statements (City Clerk’s Office) September 26 Deadline to File Campaign Expenditure Statements - First Pre-Election Statement October 21 Last Day to Register to Vote October 24 Deadline to File Campaign Expenditure Statements - Second Pre-Election Statement November 5 Election Day November 12 Last Day to Receive Vote by Mail Voter Ballots if Postmarked on Election Day December 11 Election Certified at City Council Meeting December 11 Council Reorganization – Administer Oaths of Office

*August 10 (Saturday) and August 11 (Sunday) City Hall will be closed

If you would like additional information, please contact the City Clerk at CityClerk@SanMarinoCA.gov or (626) 300-0705.

2024 Election Campaign Filings (FPPC)

2022 Election Overview

Voter Registration

Register to vote or update your registration at www.registertovote.ca.gov

Already registered? Check to be sure your registration is current at voterstatus.sos.ca.gov

General Election Information

The LA County Registrar-Recorder/County Clerk provides online information regarding the election, registering to vote, vote by mail, and more.

City Council

The following information is provided as an overview of the election process for a seat on the City Council of the City of San Marino.

Elections are consolidated with the County and are held on the first Tuesday, following the first Monday in November of even numbered years. Terms are staggered so that three seats are available during one election cycle and two seats are available during the next cycle. There are three seats up for election in the 2022 General Municipal Election. Below are important to dates to remember if you are interested in running for election. The LA County Registrar/Recorder/County Clerk also has a Municipal Information Booklet that is available online for reference. The City also provides a handbook to candidates when Nomination Papers are pulled.

Vacancy Tax

The City Council approved for submittal to the voters an ordinance that would impose a tax on specified vacant residential and commercial parcels within the City of San Marino if is approved by a two-thirds (2/3) vote of the voters voting on the measure in the Statewide General Election on November 8, 2022. Resolution No. R-22-31 Calling the Special Election for the vacancy tax measure, and Resolution No. R-22-32 consolidating the Special Election with the County can be found below. The proposed Vacancy Tax Ordinance is Exhibit A in both of the resolutions. The last day for filing direct arguments for or against the measure is August 18, 2022 by 5:00 PM, and rebuttals must be submitted no later than August 29, 2022 at 5:00 PM. Arguments and rebuttals are to be submitted to the City Clerk.

Vacancy Tax Documents

Resolution No. R-22-31 Calling the Special Election

Resolution No. R-22-32 Consolidating the Special Election with the County

Notice No. N-22-13 Vacancy Tax Ordinance Proof

Draft Ordinance No. O-22-1394 Vacancy Tax

2022 Election Information

July 18 First Day that Declaration of Candidacy / Nomination Papers are Available for Candidates August 12 Deadline to Submit Declaration of Candidacy / Nomination Papers August 17 Extended Deadline to Submit Declaration of Candidacy / Nomination Papers if an Incumbent Fails to File by August 12 August 18 Secretary of State to Determine Order of Names on Ballot August 22 - 29 Public Review Period for Candidates Statements (City Clerk’s Office) September 29 Deadline to File Campaign Expenditure Statements - First Pre-Election Statement October 24 Last Day to Register to Vote October 27 Deadline to File Campaign Expenditure Statements - Second Pre-Election Statement November 8 Election Day November 11 Last Day to Receive Vote by Mail Voter Ballots if Postmarked on Election Day December 14 Election Certified at City Council Meeting December 14 Council Reorganization – Administer Oaths of Office

If you would like additional information, please contact the City Clerk at CityClerk@CityofSanMarino.org or (626) 300-0705.

2022 GENERAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION - NOVEMBER 8, 2022

A General Municipal Election will be held on Tuesday, November 8, 2022 for the purpose of electing three members to the City of San Marino City Council.
